alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ocean and southeastern Monmouth Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lakewood, or near Toms River, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Lakewood, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Leisure Village, Allenwood, Leisure Village East, Elberon, Ramtown, Brick Township, Point Pleasant, West Long Branch, Neptune City, Brielle, Spring Lake Heights, Bradley Beach, Spring Lake and Avon-By-the-sea. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 32 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 87 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and southern New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Western Monmouth
